DataElement.preferredName: Person Dual X-ray Absorptometry Lean Body Mass Body Composition Weight In Gram Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Body composition measured by a person's lean body mass using Dual-energy X-ray Absorptiometry (DXA) measured at 8 years and older. [Manually curated]_Numeric value to represent weight in number of grams. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Dual X-ray Absorptometry Lean Body Mass Body Composition
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Body composition measured by a person's lean body mass using Dual-energy X-ray Absorptiometry (DXA) measured at 8 years and older. [Manually curated]

Property.preferredName: Dual X-ray Absorptometry Lean Body Mass Body Composition
Property.preferredDefinition: A technique for scanning bone and measuring bone mineral density (BMD). A DXA scanner produces 2 X-ray beams, each with different energy levels. One beam is high energy while the other is low energy. The amount of x-rays that pass through the bone is measured for each beam. This will vary depending on the thickness of the bone. Based on the difference between the 2 beams, the bone density can be measured. (MedicineNet.com):The mass of the body minus the fat.:The entire physical structure of an organism.  It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.:The way in which something is made, especially in terms of its different parts; its constituents.

Concepts.definition: A technique for scanning bone and measuring bone mineral density (BMD). A DXA scanner produces 2 X-ray beams, each with different energy levels. One beam is high energy while the other is low energy. The amount of x-rays that pass through the bone is measured for each beam. This will vary depending on the thickness of the bone. Based on the difference between the 2 beams, the bone density can be measured.
The mass of the body minus the fat.
The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.
The way in which something is made, especially in terms of its different parts; its constituents.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent weight in number of grams. [Manually-curated]

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to one one thousandth of a kilogram.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
